name: Manga Tracker Application
description: Developed a mobile application to track manga reading progress on third party websites. Utilized React Native, as well as Django for the backend APi. Plan on implmenting a scraped repository of manga to allow users to search and select manga. As well as a browser extension to automatically save your progerss.

name: Multi Threaded “Mini-Spark” C Program
description: Applied multi-threaded principles to create a functional Apache Spark style program. Utilized semaphores, life cycle functions, and thread functions to prevent deadlocks and maximize parallelization

name: Electronic Circuit Simulation Software
description: Worked with a team of six engineers to develop software to virtually build and test circuits; leveraged PyQt5 to create a reactive interface that stores data in a MySQL database via SQLAlchemy's database-reflection API; and implemented a CI/CD pipeline using Docker-in-Docker runners on GitLab for automated testing.

name: Cat Adoption Web Application
description: Coded using React libraries to create a multi-page, responsive, and bootstrapped application for cat adoption; programmed state variables, useEffect, routing, and other concepts to make the website fully responsive.

name: New Jersey Institute of Technology Brain Connectivity Lab
description: Utilized Python, Perl, and MATLAB for large dataset analysis to investigate group-level differences in functional connectivity between fMRI scans of different populations; researched, wrote, and submitted an undergraduate research innovation grant for a study to predict sleep stages using Hidden Markov Models (HMM).

name: Mob Control Style Android Application
description: Utilizing Unity and C# to create a Mob Control-style game prototype; conducted market research and is currently implementing a method to tutor ad display schemes to maximize revenue.
